title: Install the game on my Windows PC
description: As a Windows PC gamer, I want to run a simple, guided installer for Monopoly Tycoon, so that I can get the game set up on my computer quickly and without errors, and start playing right away.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given I have downloaded the standalone installer executable for Monopoly Tycoon on a Windows PC with sufficient disk space and administrative rights, when I run the installer and accept all default options by clicking 'Next' through the wizard, accept the EULA, and click 'Install', then The installer copies all game files to the default program files directory, a progress bar is shown, and a completion screen appears.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given I have started the installer on a machine where the target drive has less than the required 2 GB of free space, when I click the 'Install' button on the final confirmation step, then The installer must display a user-friendly error message stating that there is insufficient disk space and specifying the required amount.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given I have started the installer and am on any screen before the file copying process begins, when I click the 'Cancel' button or close the window, then A confirmation dialog appears asking if I am sure I want to exit the installation, and if I confirm, the installer closes cleanly, leaving no partial files or directories.
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria are met. The installer is a single, digitally signed .exe file. The installed application launches and runs correctly. Uninstaller is correctly registered in 'Add or Remove Programs'. The Inno Setup script is reviewed and merged.

title: Choose a custom installation directory
description: As a Windows PC user installing the game, I want to be able to choose a custom installation directory so that I can manage my disk space and organize my installed applications according to my personal preferences.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given the user is running the game installer and has reached the 'Choose Install Location' screen, when the user clicks the 'Browse...' button, selects a valid directory on a different drive (e.g., 'D:\Games'), and proceeds with the installation, then the installer successfully installs all game files into the 'D:\Games\MonopolyTycoon' directory.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the user is on the 'Choose Install Location' screen, when the user views the screen or selects a different drive, then the UI accurately displays the total disk space required for the game and the available disk space on the currently selected drive, updating dynamically when the drive is changed.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the user is on the 'Choose Install Location' screen, when the user selects a directory on a drive where the available space is less than the required space, then the installer displays a clear error message stating 'Insufficient disk space' and the 'Next' or 'Install' button is disabled.
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria are met. The custom directory choice is respected by the installer. The installer correctly checks for disk space. The Inno Setup script is reviewed and merged.

title: Provide an option to create a desktop shortcut during installation
description: As a new player installing the game, I want to see a checkbox option to create a desktop shortcut during the installation process, so that I can easily find and launch the game directly from my desktop after it's installed.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given the user is running the game installer, when the user navigates to the 'Select Additional Tasks' screen in the installer and sees the 'Create a desktop shortcut' option is checked by default, and they proceed with the installation, then a shortcut named 'Monopoly Tycoon' is created on the user's desktop.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given a desktop shortcut was created via the installer, when the user inspects the shortcut's properties, then the shortcut displays the official game icon and its target path correctly points to the game's primary executable in the chosen installation directory.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the user is running the game installer, when the user unchecks the 'Create a desktop shortcut' option and completes the installation, then no shortcut for 'Monopoly Tycoon' is created on the user's desktop.
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria are met. The shortcut is created or skipped based on user choice. The shortcut, when created, has the correct icon and target path and successfully launches the game. The Inno Setup script is reviewed and merged.

title: Ensure UI and Game View Adapt to Different Monitor Aspect Ratios
description: As a PC gamer with a monitor of any common aspect ratio, I want the game's user interface and 3D view to automatically adapt to my screen's dimensions so that I can play the game without any visual distortion, overlapping elements, or loss of critical information.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the game is launched in fullscreen mode on a display with a 16:9 aspect ratio (e.g., 1920x1080), when the user navigates to the main gameplay screen, then the game board is fully visible and centered, all HUD elements are positioned correctly in their designated corners without overlapping, and no graphical elements are stretched or compressed.
technical_tasks: Given the game is launched in fullscreen mode on a display with a 21:9 aspect ratio (e.g., 2560x1080), when the user views the main gameplay screen, then the game board maintains its correct proportions and is centered, HUD elements are correctly anchored to the corners, and modal dialogs appear centered and are not horizontally stretched.
definition_of_done: Given the game is launched on a display with an extreme aspect ratio (e.g., 32:9 or 4:3), when the user is playing the game, then the game must prioritize functionality over perfect aesthetics, ensuring the entire game board and all critical UI controls are visible and interactive, even if it requires significant letterboxing or pillarboxing.
column15: All acceptance criteria are met. The UI and game view are verified to be functional and visually correct on 16:9, 16:10, and 21:9 aspect ratios. All Unity UI Canvas and Anchor settings are reviewed and approved. No regressions are found.

title: Receive guidance on locating log files after an error
description: As a player who has encountered an unexpected game crash, I want to be shown a clear error message that includes a unique error ID and instructions on where to find the log files, so that I can easily provide developers with the necessary information to diagnose and fix the bug.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the game is running and an unhandled exception occurs in the application's code, when the global exception handler catches the exception, then a modal error dialog is displayed, blocking interaction with the game window.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the error dialog is displayed, when the user views the dialog content, then the dialog contains a non-technical message (e.g., 'An unexpected error has occurred'), a unique Error ID, and the full, absolute path to the user's log directory.
technical_tasks: Given an unhandled exception has been caught and an Error ID is displayed to the user, when the exception is processed by the logging system, then a log entry at the 'ERROR' level is written to the log file, containing the full exception details (message, stack trace) and the exact same Error ID shown in the dialog.
column14: All acceptance criteria are met. The global exception handler is implemented and successfully catches test exceptions. The error dialog displays the correct information. The log file contains a correlated, detailed error entry. The feature is reviewed and merged.

title: Uninstall the game cleanly from my computer
description: As a Windows PC user who no longer wishes to keep the game installed, I want a standard and thorough uninstallation process so that I can completely remove all application files and reclaim my disk space, ensuring my system remains clean.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the game is successfully installed on a Windows machine, when the user navigates to 'Apps & features', selects 'Monopoly Tycoon', and clicks 'Uninstall', then the uninstallation wizard is launched, and the game's entry is removed from the 'Apps & features' list upon completion.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the user has initiated the uninstallation process and confirmed they wish to proceed, when the uninstaller completes successfully, then the main installation directory and all its contents are deleted, the desktop shortcut is removed (if created), and the Start Menu folder/shortcut is removed.
technical_tasks: Given the Monopoly Tycoon game application is currently running, when the user attempts to launch the uninstaller, then the uninstaller displays a clear error message stating the game must be closed before proceeding and will not continue until the application is terminated.
column14: All acceptance criteria are met. The uninstaller removes all application files, shortcuts, and registry entries. The uninstaller correctly handles the choice to keep or remove user data. The uninstaller correctly detects if the game is running. The Inno Setup script is reviewed and merged.

title: Choose to keep my personal data upon uninstallation
description: As a Windows PC Gamer who needs to uninstall the game, I want to be given a clear choice to keep or delete my personal game data (like save files and player profile) during the uninstallation process so that I can reinstall the game later without losing all my progress and achievements.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the game is installed and the user has created personal data located in the '%APPDATA%/MonopolyTycoon' directory, when the user runs the uninstaller and selects 'No' at the prompt asking to remove personal data, then the application files and shortcuts are completely removed, but the '%APPDATA%/MonopolyTycoon' directory and all its contents remain untouched.
technical_tasks: Given the game is installed and the user has created personal data located in the '%APPDATA%/MonopolyTycoon' directory, when the user runs the uninstaller and selects 'Yes' at the prompt asking to remove personal data, then the application files and shortcuts are completely removed, AND the '%APPDATA%/MonopolyTycoon' directory and all its contents are also deleted.
definition_of_done: Given the game is installed but has never been run, so no '%APPDATA%/MonopolyTycoon' directory has been created, when the user runs the uninstaller, then the uninstallation process completes successfully without presenting a prompt to remove personal data.
column15: All acceptance criteria are met. The uninstaller provides a clear, user-friendly prompt. The choice to keep or delete data is correctly handled. The default option is to keep data. The Inno Setup script is reviewed and merged.

title: Start a new game from the main menu
description: As a player, I want to select a 'New Game' option from the main menu so that I can proceed to the game setup screen and configure a new match.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given the player is on the main menu screen, when the player clicks the 'New Game' button, then the application transitions to the Game Setup screen, and the main menu screen is no longer visible or interactive.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the player is on the main menu screen, when the player uses keyboard navigation to focus on the 'New Game' button and presses the activation key (e.g., Enter or Spacebar), then the application transitions to the Game Setup screen.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the player is on the main menu screen, when the player clicks the 'New Game' button multiple times in quick succession, then the application transitions to the Game Setup screen only once, without errors or unexpected behavior.
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria are met. The 'New Game' button is functional via mouse and keyboard. The screen transition is smooth and reliable. The code is reviewed and merged.

title: Configure a game with one to three AI opponents
description: As a player setting up a new game, I want to select the number of AI opponents from a choice of one, two, or three, so that I can customize the game's challenge, duration, and overall experience to my preference.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given I am on the game setup screen, when I select '3' as the number of AI opponents and start the game, then a new game session is created with a total of four players: one human and three AIs.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given I am on the game setup screen, when I change the selected number of AI opponents from '1' to '3', then the UI dynamically updates to display configuration sections for three distinct AI opponents.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given I am interacting with the UI for selecting the number of opponents, when I view the available options, then the only selectable options are '1', '2', and '3'.
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria are met. The UI allows selection of 1, 2, or 3 opponents. The selection correctly determines the number of players in the game. The UI dynamically updates to show the correct number of AI configuration slots. The code is reviewed and merged.

title: Set a unique difficulty level for each AI opponent
description: As a Human Player setting up a new game, I want to independently assign a difficulty level (Easy, Medium, or Hard) to each of my AI opponents so that I can customize the game's challenge to match my skill level and desired experience, enhancing replayability.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given I am on the Game Setup screen and have selected 3 AI opponents, when I set the difficulty for 'AI 1' to 'Easy', 'AI 2' to 'Hard', and 'AI 3' to 'Medium', then the UI must clearly display the correct selections, and upon starting the game, each AI's PlayerState object has the correct 'ai_difficulty' value assigned.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given I am on the Game Setup screen, when I increase the number of AI opponents from 1 to 2, then a new UI section for 'AI 2' appears, and its difficulty selector defaults to 'Medium'.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given I have configured 3 AI opponents with difficulties 'Hard', 'Easy', and 'Medium', when I reduce the number of AI opponents from 3 to 2, then the UI for 'AI 3' is removed, and the difficulty settings for 'AI 1' ('Hard') and 'AI 2' ('Easy') remain unchanged.
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria are met. The UI for setting AI difficulty is functional and independent for each AI slot. The selected difficulties are correctly passed to the game state upon starting a new game. The code is reviewed and merged.

title: Create a player profile with a custom name
description: As a new or returning player, I want to create a personal profile by entering a custom name, so that my game progress, historical statistics, and high scores are saved and displayed under my unique identity, enhancing my sense of ownership and achievement.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the player is on the game setup screen which contains a profile name input field, when the player enters a valid name (e.g., 'BoardwalkKing') and proceeds with game setup, then a new player profile is created and persisted with the entered name and a unique internal profile_id.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given a player has successfully created a profile with the name 'CashMoney', when the game starts, then the human player's name is displayed as 'CashMoney' in the main game HUD.
technical_tasks: Given the player is on the game setup screen, when the player enters a name with fewer than 3 characters, more than 16 characters, or with special characters, then a user-friendly validation message is displayed and the game setup does not proceed.
column14: All acceptance criteria are met. The system correctly creates and persists a player profile. The entered name is used in-game. All validation rules for the name are enforced. The code is reviewed and merged.

title: Receive feedback for an invalid profile name
description: As a player setting up my profile, I want to receive immediate and clear feedback if the name I enter is invalid, so that I can easily correct it and proceed to start the game without frustration.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given the player is on the game setup screen in the profile name input field, when the player enters a name with fewer than 3 characters (e.g., 'Al'), then a specific error message 'Name must be at least 3 characters long' is displayed below the input field, and the option to proceed is disabled.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the player is on the game setup screen in the profile name input field, when the player enters a name containing special characters (e.g., 'Player!@#'), then a specific error message 'Name can only contain letters and numbers' is displayed, and the option to proceed is disabled.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the player has entered an invalid name and an error message is currently displayed, when the player edits the name so that it meets all validation criteria, then the error message disappears, and the option to proceed becomes enabled.
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria are met. The UI provides clear, real-time feedback for all invalid name conditions. The 'Start Game' button state correctly reflects the validity of the input. The code is reviewed and merged.

title: View my persistent historical gameplay statistics
description: As a returning player, I want to access a dedicated screen that displays my cumulative gameplay statistics from all my completed games, so that I can track my performance, see my win/loss record, and feel a sense of long-term progression and achievement.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the player has completed at least one game and has historical statistics saved, when the player selects the 'Player Statistics' option from the main menu, then a dedicated statistics screen is displayed showing correct values for all required metrics (Total games, Wins, W/L ratio, etc.).
technical_tasks: Given the player has created a profile but has not completed any games, when the player navigates to the 'Player Statistics' screen, then the screen displays all statistical categories with appropriate default values (e.g., 'Total Games Played: 0', 'Win/Loss Ratio: N/A').
definition_of_done: Given the player has existing statistics, including 'Total Games Played' = 5 and 'Total Wins' = 2, when the player completes and wins a new game, then upon returning to the statistics screen, 'Total Games Played' displays '6', 'Total Wins' displays '3', and the Win/Loss Ratio is recalculated correctly.
column15: All acceptance criteria are met. Statistics are correctly saved, aggregated, and displayed. The system handles the zero-data state gracefully. The UI is reviewed and approved. The data access code is unit tested and merged.

title: Select my player token from a set of classic options
description: As a player setting up a new game, I want to choose my game piece from a visual selection of classic tokens, so that I can personalize my in-game identity and feel more connected to the game experience.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the player is on the game setup screen, when the player clicks on an available token (e.g., 'Top Hat') from the selection interface, then the 'Top Hat' token becomes visually highlighted, and a preview is shown next to the player's name.
technical_tasks: Given the player has selected a token and configured a game with 3 AI opponents, when the player starts the game, then the AI opponents are each assigned a unique token from the pool of tokens not selected by the human player.
definition_of_done: Given the player selected the 'Battleship' token during game setup and started the game, when the main game view loads, then the player's 3D game piece on the board is the 'Battleship', and the player's icon in the HUD is the 'Battleship'.
column15: All acceptance criteria are met. The token selection UI is functional. The selected token is correctly used in-game. AI opponents are assigned unique, non-conflicting tokens. The code is reviewed and merged.

title: Roll two six-sided dice to start my move
description: As a human player whose turn it is, I want to click a button to roll two virtual dice, so that I can determine the number of spaces my token will move and proceed with my turn.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given it is the human player's turn and they are in the 'Pre-Roll Management Phase', when the player clicks the 'Roll Dice' button, then the system generates two random integer values, each between 1 and 6 inclusive, a 3D dice animation is displayed, and the game state transitions to the 'Movement Phase'.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given it is an AI player's turn OR the human player is not in the 'Pre-Roll Management Phase', when the game state is updated, then the 'Roll Dice' button is visually disabled and non-interactive.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the player clicks the 'Roll Dice' button, when the result of the two dice is identical values (e.g., 3 and 3), then the system correctly identifies the roll as doubles and sets a flag in the PlayerState to indicate an extra turn may be granted.
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria are met. Dice rolling is functional, fair, and visually represented. The button state is correctly managed. The doubles condition is detected. The feature is unit and integration tested and merged.

title: Watch my token automatically move around the board
description: As a player, I want to see my game token animate its movement from one space to the next after I roll the dice, so that I can visually track my progress around the board and have an immersive, intuitive gameplay experience.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the player's token is on 'St. Charles Place' (index 11) and the game speed is 'Normal', when the player completes a dice roll with a total of 5, then the token animates moving sequentially across 5 spaces, landing on 'Indiana Avenue' (index 16), and the camera smoothly follows the token's movement.
technical_tasks: Given the player's token is on 'Park Place' (index 37), when the player completes a dice roll with a total of 6, then the token animates moving sequentially, clearly passing over the 'GO' space, before landing on 'Reading Railroad' (index 5).
definition_of_done: Given a player's turn results in them being sent to Jail, when the game logic directs the player to Jail, then the token does not animate space-by-space, but instead a special, direct animation plays, moving the token from its current space directly to the 'In Jail' section of the board.
column15: All acceptance criteria are met. Token movement animation is smooth and accurate for standard and GO-passing moves. The animation respects game speed settings. The special 'Go to Jail' movement is implemented. The code is reviewed and merged.

title: Receive an extra turn after rolling doubles
description: As a player (human or AI), I want to be granted an immediate, additional turn after I roll doubles, so that the game correctly follows the official Monopoly rules and provides an authentic gameplay experience.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given it is a player's turn and their consecutive doubles count is 0, when the player rolls the dice and the result is doubles, then the player's token moves, the destination space action is completed, and the game returns to the 'Pre-Roll Management Phase' for the same player.
technical_tasks: Given a player has just completed a turn by rolling doubles, when the player rolls the dice again on their extra turn and the result is not a double, then the player moves, completes the action, and the turn passes to the next player in sequence.
definition_of_done: Given a player is in the 'InJail' state and chooses to roll the dice, when the player rolls doubles, then the player gets out of jail, moves, completes their action, and their turn ends; they are NOT granted an extra turn.
column15: All acceptance criteria are met. The doubles rule is correctly implemented for granting an extra turn. The exception for getting out of jail is correctly handled. The logic is unit tested and merged.

title: Be sent to jail for rolling three consecutive doubles
description: As a player, I want the game to automatically send my token to jail if I roll three consecutive doubles in a single turn, so that the game correctly enforces the official rules and maintains the strategic balance of risk and reward associated with rolling doubles.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given a player is taking their turn and has already rolled doubles twice in a row, when the player rolls the dice for a third time and the result is doubles, then the player's token is immediately moved directly to the 'In Jail' space, their player status is set to 'InJail', and their turn ends.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given a player has rolled doubles twice and is on a space near GO (e.g., Boardwalk), when the player rolls their third consecutive double, then the player's token is sent directly to Jail and does not collect the $200 GO salary.
technical_tasks: Given a player has rolled doubles once or twice consecutively, when the player's next roll in the same turn is not doubles, then the player moves normally, their turn ends, and their consecutive doubles counter is reset to zero.
column14: All acceptance criteria are met. The three-doubles-to-jail rule is correctly implemented. The rule correctly overrides normal movement and GO salary collection. The doubles counter is correctly managed. The logic is unit tested and merged.

title: Collect $200 salary when passing or landing on GO
description: As a Player, I want my cash balance to be automatically credited with a $200 salary when my token passes over or lands on the GO space, so that the game correctly follows the official rules and I receive the funds I am entitled to for completing a lap of the board.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given a player's token is on 'Boardwalk' (space 39) with a cash balance of $500, when the player rolls a 5, causing their token to move past GO and land on 'Baltic Avenue' (space 3), then the player's cash balance is automatically increased to $700.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given a player's token is on 'Park Place' (space 37) with a cash balance of $500, when the player rolls a 3, causing their token to land exactly on 'GO' (space 0), then the player's cash balance is automatically increased to $700.
technical_tasks: Given a player's token is on 'Pennsylvania Avenue' (space 28) with a cash balance of $500, when the player rolls a 2 and lands on the 'Go to Jail' space (space 30), then the player's token is moved directly to the 'In Jail' location and their cash balance remains $500.
column14: All acceptance criteria are met. GO salary is correctly awarded for both passing and landing. The exception for 'Go to Jail' moves is handled correctly. The logic is unit tested and merged.

title: Get out of jail by paying the $50 fine
description: As a player who is in jail, I want to be presented with the option to pay a $50 fine at the beginning of my turn, so that I can immediately get out of jail and continue my turn normally, allowing me to maintain momentum in the game.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given I am in the 'InJail' state, it is the start of my turn, and my cash balance is >= $50, when the game presents the 'Get Out of Jail' options and I select the 'Pay $50 Fine' option, then my cash balance is reduced by $50, my player status is updated to 'Active', and I proceed to the Pre-Roll Management phase of my turn.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given I am in the 'InJail' state and my cash balance is $49, when the game presents the 'Get Out of Jail' options, then the 'Pay $50 Fine' option is visually disabled and non-interactive.
technical_tasks: Given I am in the 'InJail' state, it is the start of my turn, and my cash balance is exactly $50, when I select the 'Pay $50 Fine' option, then my cash balance is reduced to $0, my player status is updated to 'Active', and I proceed with my turn.
column14: All acceptance criteria are met. The option to pay the fine is correctly presented and functional. The player's state and cash are updated correctly. The option is correctly disabled when funds are insufficient. The logic is unit tested and merged.

title: Get out of jail by using a 'Get Out of Jail Free' card
description: As a player who is in jail and owns a 'Get Out of Jail Free' card, I want to be presented with the option to use it at the start of my turn, so that I can get out of jail immediately without spending money or relying on a lucky dice roll.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the player's status is 'InJail', it is the start of their turn, and their 'get_out_of_jail_cards' count is 1, when the player is presented with their jail options and selects 'Use Get Out of Jail Free Card', then the player's 'status' is updated to 'Active', their 'get_out_of_jail_cards' count becomes 0, and they proceed to the Pre-Roll Management Phase of a normal turn.
technical_tasks: Given the player uses a 'Get Out of Jail Free' card that originated from the Chance deck, when the action to use the card is confirmed, then the specific 'Get Out of Jail Free' card is placed at the bottom of the Chance card deck.
definition_of_done: Given the player's status is 'InJail' and their 'get_out_of_jail_cards' count is 0, when their turn begins and the jail options are presented, then the UI option to 'Use Get Out of Jail Free Card' is not displayed or is disabled.
column15: All acceptance criteria are met. The option to use the card is correctly presented based on player inventory. Using the card correctly updates player status and card count. The used card is correctly returned to the bottom of its origin deck. The feature is unit tested and merged.

title: Attempt to get out of jail by rolling for doubles
description: As a player in jail, I want to choose the option to roll the dice on my turn, so that I can attempt to get out of jail for free by rolling doubles, preserving my cash and 'Get Out of Jail Free' cards.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given I am in the Jail space with a status of 'InJail' and it is the start of my turn, when I select the 'Roll for Doubles' option and the roll result is doubles, then my player status is updated from 'InJail' to 'Active', my token moves the number of spaces shown on the dice, and my turn ends (without an extra roll).
technical_tasks: Given I am in the Jail space with a status of 'InJail' and it is the start of my turn, when I select the 'Roll for Doubles' option and the roll result is not doubles, then my 'jail_turns_remaining' is decremented by 1 and my turn immediately ends.
definition_of_done: Given it is the start of my turn and I am in jail, when the pre-roll management phase begins, then a modal UI dialog is presented with my available options, including a clearly labeled 'Roll for Doubles' button.
column15: All acceptance criteria are met. The player can choose to roll for doubles. A successful roll releases the player and ends their turn. A failed roll decrements the attempt counter and ends their turn. The correct UI is presented. The logic is unit tested and merged.

title: Be forced to pay the fine after failing to roll doubles for 3 turns in jail
description: As a player in jail for my third consecutive turn, I want the game to automatically force me to pay the $50 fine if I fail to roll doubles, so that the official game rules are enforced and my turn can proceed correctly.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given a player is in the 'InJail' state, their 'jail_turns_remaining' count is 1 (indicating the 3rd attempt), and they have more than $50 cash, when the player rolls the dice and the result is not doubles, then the player's cash balance is reduced by $50, their status changes to 'Active', and their token moves the number of spaces shown on the dice.
technical_tasks: Given a player is in the 'InJail' state and their 'jail_turns_remaining' count is 1, when the player chooses to roll the dice and the result is doubles, then the player's cash balance is not changed, their status changes to 'Active', and their token moves, but their turn ends without an extra roll.
definition_of_done: Given a player is in the 'InJail' state, their 'jail_turns_remaining' count is 1, and they have less than $50 cash, when the player rolls the dice and the result is not doubles, then the game flow is paused, and the player is prompted to raise funds to cover the $50 debt before movement occurs.
column15: All acceptance criteria are met. The third-fail-to-roll rule is correctly enforced, including payment and movement. The exception for rolling doubles on the third try is handled. The system correctly integrates with asset liquidation/bankruptcy for players with insufficient funds. The feature is unit and integration tested and merged.

title: Draw a Chance card when landing on a Chance space
description: As a player, I want the game to automatically draw a Chance card and execute its instructions when my token lands on a Chance space, so that the game follows the official rules and introduces the element of luck and surprise.
technical_tasks: Given a player has $1000 cash and the top card of the Chance deck is 'Bank pays you dividend of $50', when the player's token lands on a Chance space, then a UI element displays the card, the player's cash balance becomes $1050, and the card is placed at the bottom of the Chance deck.
definition_of_done: Given a player has 0 'Get Out of Jail Free' cards, when the player lands on a Chance space and draws the 'Get Out of Jail Free' card, then the card is displayed, the player's 'get_out_of_jail_cards' count in their PlayerState becomes 1, and this specific card is removed from the deck cycle until used.
column14: Given a player is on any Chance space, when the player draws the 'Go to Jail' card, then the card is displayed, the player's token moves directly to the 'In Jail' space, their status is set to 'InJail', and their turn immediately ends without collecting GO salary.
column16: All acceptance criteria are met. All Chance card effects are implemented correctly. The deck is managed correctly (shuffled at start, cards returned to bottom, GOOJFC held). The UI provides clear feedback. Card data is loaded from external files. The logic is unit tested and merged.

title: Draw a Community Chest card when landing on a Community Chest space
description: As a player, I want the game to automatically draw a Community Chest card and execute its instructions when my token lands on a Community Chest space, so that the game correctly follows the official rules of Monopoly and the game state is updated accordingly without manual effort.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given a player lands on Community Chest, when they draw a card instructing them to collect money (e.g., 'Bank error in your favor. Collect $200'), then the player's cash balance in their PlayerState object and the HUD is increased by the specified amount.
technical_tasks: Given a player lands on Community Chest, when they draw the 'Get Out of Jail Free' card, then the player's 'get_out_of_jail_cards' count is incremented by one, and the card is removed from the deck until it is used.
definition_of_done: Given a player has insufficient cash and assets to cover a payment, when they draw a Community Chest card that requires a payment (e.g., 'Hospital Fees. Pay $100'), then the game's standard bankruptcy procedure is triggered.
column15: All acceptance criteria are met. All Community Chest card effects are implemented correctly, including payments, movement, and player-to-player transactions. The deck is managed correctly. title: Choose to pay $200 or 10% of my net worth for Income Tax
description: As a human player, I want to be presented with a clear choice between paying a flat $200 or 10% of my total net worth when I land on the Income Tax space, so that I can make the most strategic financial decision to preserve my cash and improve my chances of winning.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the human player's turn is active and their token's movement ends on the 'Income Tax' space, when the player's movement phase concludes, then the game flow pauses and a modal dialog is displayed to the player with the two payment options.

definition_of_done: Given the player has $100 cash and a total net worth of $1500, when the player selects either the '$200' or '$150' option, then the game initiates the bankruptcy/asset liquidation flow, requiring the player to mortgage properties or sell buildings to cover the chosen debt.
column15: All acceptance criteria are met. The net worth calculation is accurate. The choice dialog is presented correctly to the human player. The selected payment is processed correctly. The system integrates with the bankruptcy/liquidation flow for insufficient funds. The logic is unit tested and merged.

title: Pay a fixed Luxury Tax amount
user_role: The human player or any AI player
description: As a player, I want the game to automatically deduct the fixed Luxury Tax amount from my cash when I land on that space, so that the game correctly follows the official rules and I can continue my turn without manual calculations.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given a player has a cash balance greater than the Luxury Tax amount, when the player's token movement ends on the 'Luxury Tax' space, then the fixed tax amount is automatically deducted from the player's cash balance, a notification is shown, and the transaction is logged.
technical_tasks: Given a player has a cash balance less than the Luxury Tax amount but owns assets, when the player's token movement ends on the 'Luxury Tax' space, then the game flow is paused, and the player is prompted to manage their assets to pay the debt.

column15: All acceptance criteria are met. The tax is automatically deducted for players with sufficient funds. The system correctly integrates with the asset liquidation and bankruptcy flows for players with insufficient funds. The logic is unit tested and merged.

title: Experience no gameplay effect when landing on Free Parking
description: As a player, I want the game to apply no special action when my token lands on the Free Parking space so that the game adheres to the official Monopoly rules and my turn proceeds correctly.
technical_tasks: Given a player is in an active turn and has not rolled doubles, when the player's token movement concludes on the 'Free Parking' space, then the player's cash balance remains unchanged, no action prompt is displayed, and the game proceeds to the next player's turn.
definition_of_done: Given a player is in an active turn and has not rolled three consecutive doubles, when the player rolls doubles and their token movement concludes on the 'Free Parking' space, then the player's cash balance remains unchanged, no action prompt is displayed, and the game prompts the player to take their extra turn.
column14: Given a player is on a space before GO (e.g., Boardwalk) with $500 cash, when the player rolls a number that causes them to pass GO and land on 'Free Parking', then the player's cash balance first increases by $200 for passing GO, resulting in a final balance of $700, and the 'Free Parking' space itself has no further effect.
column16: All acceptance criteria are met. The Free Parking space correctly functions as a 'no-op' space. The game correctly handles turn progression (ending the turn or granting an extra turn for doubles). The logic is unit tested and merged.

title: Manage my properties before rolling the dice
description: As a strategic player, I want a dedicated phase at the start of my turn to manage my properties (build, mortgage, trade) before I roll the dice, so that I can proactively adjust my financial position and property development to prepare for the opportunities and risks of my upcoming move.
technical_tasks: Given it is the start of the human player's turn, and the player is not in jail, when the game transitions control to the human player, then the game enters a 'Pre-Roll Management Phase', the 'Roll Dice' button is enabled, and all property management UI controls are enabled.
definition_of_done: Given the player is in the 'Pre-Roll Management Phase', when the player successfully builds a house on a property and then clicks the 'Roll Dice' button, then the house is correctly added, cash is deducted, the property management controls become disabled, and the game proceeds to the 'Roll Phase'.
column14: Given the player has just completed a turn where they rolled doubles, when the game grants the player an extra turn, then the game returns to the 'Pre-Roll Management Phase', allowing the player to manage properties again before their next roll.
column16: All acceptance criteria are met. The game loop correctly implements the Pre-Roll Management phase. The UI correctly enables/disables management controls based on the turn phase. The logic handles standard turns, doubles turns, and in-jail turns correctly. The feature is integration tested and merged.

title: Choose to buy an unowned property I land on
description: As a human player, I want to be presented with a clear, informative prompt when I land on an unowned property, giving me the option to purchase it for its listed price, so that I can strategically acquire assets, build monopolies, and progress towards winning the game.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given I am the human player with sufficient cash, when my token's movement ends on an unowned property, then the game pauses and a modal dialog is displayed with property details and enabled 'Buy' and 'Auction' buttons.
technical_tasks: Given I am the human player with sufficient funds and the purchase dialog is displayed, when I click the 'Buy' button, then my cash is debited by the list price, the property is added to my asset list, the board's visual ownership indicator is updated, and my turn proceeds.
definition_of_done: Given I am the human player with insufficient funds to afford a property, when I land on it, then the purchase dialog is displayed but the 'Buy' button is disabled, leaving 'Auction' as the primary option.
column15: All acceptance criteria are met. The purchase dialog is correctly triggered. The 'Buy' action works as expected. The UI correctly handles the insufficient funds case. The feature is unit and integration tested and merged.

title: Choose to send an unowned property to auction instead of buying it
description: As a Human Player, I want the option to decline the immediate purchase of an unowned property I land on so that I can trigger an auction for that property, allowing me to either acquire it for a lower price or force other players to spend their cash.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given I am the human player, it is my turn, and I have landed on an unowned property, when the game presents me with a modal dialog to buy the property, then the dialog must display two distinct, enabled options: 'Buy' and 'Auction'.
technical_tasks: Given the purchase decision dialog for an unowned property is displayed, when I click the 'Auction' button, then the purchase decision dialog closes immediately and the auction process begins, involving all active players (human and AI).
definition_of_done: Given I am the human player with insufficient funds, when the game presents me with the purchase decision dialog, then the 'Buy' button must be visually disabled and non-interactive, and the 'Auction' button must remain enabled.
column15: All acceptance criteria are met. The 'Auction' button is present and functional on the purchase dialog. Clicking it correctly triggers the auction system. The UI state is correct for both sufficient and insufficient funds scenarios. The feature is integration tested and merged.

title: Participate in an auction for a property
description: As a Human Player, I want to participate in a turn-based auction for an unowned property, placing bids against AI opponents, so that I have a strategic opportunity to acquire properties that were not purchased outright and can compete to complete my sets or block my opponents.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given an auction is in progress for 'Boardwalk' and it is the human player's turn to bid, when the human player places a valid winning bid and all other players withdraw, then the auction UI closes, the final bid amount is deducted from the human player's cash, and the 'Boardwalk' property is added to their portfolio.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given an auction is in progress and it is the human player's turn to bid, when the human player selects the 'Withdraw' or 'Pass' option, then the human player is marked as inactive for this auction, their bidding controls are disabled, and the turn passes to the next player.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given an auction is in progress, the current high bid is $200, and the human player has $205 cash, when it is the human player's turn and the minimum next bid is $206, then the 'Place Bid' button is disabled and a visual cue indicates insufficient funds.
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria are met. The auction UI is functional. Players can win, lose, or withdraw from auctions. Bidding rules, turn order, and financial constraints are correctly enforced. The logic is unit tested and merged.

title: Build houses on properties in a complete color set
description: As a player who owns a complete color set, I want to purchase and build houses on those properties so that I can increase the rent value and gain a strategic advantage over my opponents.
technical_tasks: Given I am the active player with a full, unmortgaged, undeveloped monopoly and sufficient cash, when I choose to build one house on a property in that set, then my cash is reduced by the house cost, the bank's available house count decreases by one, and a visual representation of one house appears on the board.
definition_of_done: Given I own Oriental Avenue and Vermont Avenue, but not Connecticut Avenue, when I access the property management screen, then the option to build houses on my Light Blue properties is disabled or hidden, with a message indicating a complete set is required.
column14: Given I own the complete Light Blue monopoly and have $49 cash, when I attempt to build a house on any Light Blue property (costing $50), then the build action is disabled or fails with an 'Insufficient Funds' notification, and my cash remains unchanged.
column16: All acceptance criteria are met. Players can successfully build houses on monopolies. All prerequisites (monopoly ownership, sufficient funds, bank supply, no mortgage) are correctly enforced. The even building rule is respected. The logic is unit tested and merged.

title: Enforce even building rule for property development
description: As a player who owns a complete property set (a monopoly), I want the game to enforce the 'even building' rule when I try to purchase or sell houses, so that the game is fair, follows official Monopoly rules, and maintains its strategic economic balance.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given I own a three-property monopoly where Property A has 1 house, and Properties B and C have 0 houses, when I attempt to build a second house on Property A, then the action is blocked, and the UI provides feedback explaining that I must build evenly.
technical_tasks: Given I own a monopoly where every property has exactly one house, when I attempt to build a second house on any single property in that set, then the transaction is successful, and the selected property now has two houses.
definition_of_done: Given I own a monopoly where Property A has 3 houses, and Properties B and C each have 2 houses, when I attempt to sell a house from Property B or C, then the action is blocked, and the UI indicates that I must sell from the property with the most houses first (Property A).
column15: All acceptance criteria are met. The even building rule is strictly enforced for both purchasing and selling houses. The UI provides clear feedback for blocked actions. The logic handles monopolies of different sizes correctly. The logic is unit tested and merged.

title: Upgrade a set of 4 houses to a single hotel
description: As a strategic player who has acquired a full monopoly and developed it with four houses on each property, I want to purchase a hotel for each of those properties, returning the four houses to the bank, so that I can charge the maximum possible rent and increase my chances of winning the game.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given I own a complete monopoly where every property has exactly 4 houses, I have sufficient cash, and the Bank has at least one hotel, when I initiate the 'Build Hotel' action on one of those properties, then my cash is reduced by the hotel's cost, the Bank's hotel count decreases by 1, the Bank's house count increases by 4, and the property's state is updated to have 1 hotel.
technical_tasks: Given I own a monopoly where two properties have 4 houses, but a third property has only 3 houses, when I select any property within that monopoly in the property management UI, then the option to build a hotel is not available or is disabled.
definition_of_done: Given I am eligible to purchase a hotel, when I attempt to purchase one, but the Bank's supply of 12 hotels is exhausted, then the transaction is blocked, and a UI notification clearly informs me of the hotel shortage.
column15: All acceptance criteria are met. The hotel upgrade transaction correctly updates all parts of the game state (player cash, bank inventory, property state). All prerequisites (4 houses on all properties, sufficient funds, bank supply) are correctly enforced. The logic is unit tested and merged.

title: Notify player of building shortage when attempting to build
description: As a player trying to develop my properties, I want to receive a clear, immediate notification when I am unable to build because the bank has run out of houses or hotels, so that I understand the game state and can adjust my strategy without thinking the game is broken.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given I am on the Property Management screen and own an eligible monopoly, when I attempt to purchase a house and the bank's supply of houses is 0, then the purchase action is prevented, my cash remains unchanged, and a non-modal notification appears with text like 'Cannot build: No houses available in the bank.'
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the bank's supply of a building type (e.g., houses) is 0, when I view my properties in the Property Management interface, then the corresponding 'Build House' button(s) for all eligible properties are visually disabled and non-interactive.
technical_tasks: Given the bank's supply of houses was 0 and the 'Build House' buttons were disabled, when an in-game event returns houses to the bank, making the supply greater than 0, then the 'Build House' buttons in my Property Management interface become enabled and interactive again on my turn.
column14: All acceptance criteria are met. The UI correctly reflects building unavailability due to shortages. The player receives clear feedback when attempting to build during a shortage. The UI state correctly updates when buildings are returned to the bank. The logic is unit tested and merged.

title: Participate in an auction for the last available buildings
description: As a strategic player, I want to participate in an auction for the last available houses or hotels when there's a building shortage, so that I have a fair, rule-compliant chance to acquire these critical assets and gain a competitive advantage.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the Bank has only 2 houses remaining, and it is the Human Player's turn who wishes to build, when multiple players are eligible to build, then the game identifies the building shortage and initiates an auction for the 2 available houses, one at a time.
technical_tasks: Given a building auction is active and it is the Human Player's turn to bid, when the auction UI is presented to the player, then the UI must clearly display the item being auctioned (e.g., '1 House'), the current high bid, and allow the player to 'Bid' or 'Pass'.
definition_of_done: Given a building auction for one house is active, when a player places the winning bid, then the auction for that house concludes, the winner pays their bid amount to the bank, the house is placed on their property, and if more buildings are available, a new auction begins for the next one.
column15: All acceptance criteria are met. The building auction is correctly triggered during a shortage with multiple eligible buyers. The auction UI is functional. The auction correctly resolves for each building one at a time. The logic is unit tested and merged.

title: Mortgage an undeveloped property to get cash
description: As a player managing my finances, I want to mortgage my undeveloped properties to the Bank, so that I can receive immediate cash to pay debts, fund purchases, or avoid bankruptcy.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given I am the active player, it is my turn, and I own an undeveloped and unmortgaged property, when I select the property in the Property Management interface and confirm the 'Mortgage' action, then my cash balance increases by the property's mortgage value, the property's state is updated to 'mortgaged', and its visual indicator on the board changes.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given I am the active player and I own a property with one or more houses on it, when I open the Property Management interface and select the developed property, then the 'Mortgage' option is disabled or not visible, with a message explaining buildings must be sold first.
technical_tasks: Given I own a mortgaged property, when an opponent's token lands on that property space, then no rent transaction occurs and my cash balance remains unchanged.
column14: All acceptance criteria are met. Players can successfully mortgage undeveloped properties. The transaction is financially correct and updates the game state. The rule preventing mortgaging of developed properties is enforced. Rent is not collected on mortgaged properties. The logic is unit tested and merged.

title: Unmortgage a property by paying the principal plus 10% interest
description: As a Human Player managing my assets, I want to pay the bank to unmortgage one of my properties so that I can start collecting rent on it again and enable future development.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given I am the active player, it is my turn, and I own a mortgaged property (e.g., 'St. Charles Place', mortgage value $70), when I select to unmortgage it for $77 (principal + 10%) and have sufficient funds, then exactly $77 is deducted from my cash, the property's state is updated to 'unmortgaged', and its visual indicator on the board reverts to normal.

definition_of_done: Given I have successfully unmortgaged a property, when an opponent lands on it later in the game, then rent is collected as normal.
column15: All acceptance criteria are met. Players can successfully unmortgage properties. The transaction cost, including the 10% interest, is calculated correctly. The insufficient funds case is handled. Rent collection is correctly re-enabled. The logic is unit tested and merged.

title: Initiate a trade with an AI opponent during my turn
description: As a human player, I want to open a trading interface, select an AI opponent, and construct a trade offer involving cash, properties, and cards, so that I can strategically negotiate to acquire the properties I need to complete monopolies and increase my chances of winning the game.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given it is the human player's turn, during the Pre-Roll Management Phase, when the player opens the trade interface, selects a valid AI opponent, constructs an offer, and clicks 'Propose Trade', then the trade proposal is submitted to the selected AI's decision-making module for evaluation.

definition_of_done: Given it is currently an AI opponent's turn, when the human player attempts to access the trade functionality, then the UI button or menu option to initiate a trade is disabled or hidden.

title: Respond to a trade offer from an AI opponent
description: As a human player, I want to be presented with a clear, interactive dialog when an AI opponent proposes a trade, showing exactly what is being offered and requested, so that I can evaluate the strategic value of the deal and make an informed decision to either accept or decline it.

Declining the trade correctly cancels the transaction. The UI is clear and unambiguous. The feature is integration tested and merged.

title: Propose a counter-offer to an AI's trade proposal

title: Receive a non-intrusive notification when AI players trade with each other

column14: All acceptance criteria are met. Notifications for AI-to-AI trades are displayed correctly and are non-intrusive. The notification text provides a clear summary. The feature works correctly on all game speed settings. The code is reviewed and merged.

title: See a victory screen when I am the last player remaining

title: View at-a-glance information for all players in the HUD

title: See clear visual indicators of property ownership on the board
