title: Interact with modal dialogs for critical decisions
description: As a human player, I want the game to pause and display a focused, interactive pop-up for critical, turn-halting decisions, so that I can consciously evaluate my options and make informed choices without the risk of missing important game events.
technical_tasks: Given I am the human player and I land on an unowned property, when my turn is active, then the game's background processes are paused, a modal dialog is displayed showing the property's title deed, and it presents me with 'Buy' and 'Auction' buttons.
definition_of_done: Given an AI opponent has proposed a trade, when the trade offer is presented to me, then the game's background processes are paused, a modal dialog is displayed showing the assets being exchanged, and it presents me with 'Accept', 'Decline', and 'Propose Counter-Offer' buttons.
column14: Given any critical decision modal dialog is active on screen, when I attempt to click on any UI element outside of the modal dialog (e.g., the main HUD, the game board), then the clicks are ignored, and only interactions with the elements inside the modal dialog are registered.
column16: All acceptance criteria are met. A reusable modal dialog system is implemented. The system correctly pauses the game and blocks background interactions. The system is successfully used for property purchase, trade responses, and tax decisions. The code is reviewed and merged.

title: Access a dedicated interface to manage all my properties
description: As a human player managing my in-game assets, I want to access a dedicated property management screen so that I can efficiently view the status of all my properties and take strategic actions like building or mortgaging from a single, consolidated interface.
definition_of_done: Given it is the human player's turn, before they have rolled the dice, when the player clicks the 'Manage Properties' button in the main HUD, then a dedicated property management screen is displayed, listing all owned properties grouped by color set.
column14: Given the player has a complete, undeveloped monopoly and sufficient cash, when the player selects a property from that monopoly and clicks the 'Build House' button, then the player's cash is debited by the correct building cost and the UI updates immediately.
column15: Given the player owns a monopoly where one property has 1 house and the others have 0, when the player selects the property that already has 1 house, then the 'Build House' button for that property is disabled, and an informative tooltip explains that building must be even across the set.
column17: All acceptance criteria are met. The property management screen is accessible and functional. It correctly displays all owned properties and their states. All management actions (build, sell, mortgage, unmortgage) are available and their respective business rules are enforced by the UI. The feature is integration tested and merged.

title: Use a two-panel interface to build and review trade offers
description: As a Human Player, I want a clear, two-panel trading interface that displays my items and the opponent's items side-by-side so that I can easily construct, review, and understand trade offers to make strategic decisions effectively.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the player selects an AI opponent and chooses the 'Trade' option, when it is their turn, then a modal trading interface appears, displaying two main panels: 'Your Offer' and 'Their Offer', with both players' available assets displayed for selection.
technical_tasks: Given the trading interface is open, when the player adds one of their properties, enters a cash amount, and adds one of the AI's properties to the offer, then all selected items appear correctly in their respective panels, and the 'Propose Trade' button becomes enabled.
definition_of_done: Given an AI opponent initiates a trade with the human player, when the trade offer is presented to the player, then the same two-panel interface appears, pre-populated with the AI's offer, and buttons for 'Accept', 'Decline', and 'Propose Counter-Offer' are displayed.
column15: All acceptance criteria are met. The two-panel trading UI is implemented and functional for player-initiated trades, AI-initiated trades, and counter-offers. The UI correctly validates offers against business rules (no developed properties, sufficient cash). The feature is integration tested and merged.

title: Access an in-game settings menu
description: As a player in the middle of a game, I want to access a settings menu without quitting the match, so that I can adjust game options, save my progress, or exit the game in a controlled manner.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given a game is in progress and it is the human player's turn, when the player presses the 'Escape' key or clicks the 'Settings' icon on the HUD, then the game simulation is paused and a settings menu is displayed as an overlay.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the in-game settings menu is open, when the player views the menu, then the menu must contain distinct, clickable options for 'Resume Game', 'Settings', 'Save Game', 'Load Game', and 'Return to Main Menu'.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given a game is in progress and an AI opponent is taking its turn, when the human player opens the settings menu, then all AI processing and game animations are paused, and when the player resumes the game, the AI's turn continues from the exact point it was interrupted.
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria are met. The in-game settings menu is accessible and functional. It correctly pauses and resumes the game state for both human and AI turns. It serves as a container for other settings-related features. The feature is integration tested and merged.

title: Adjust the game speed to make animations faster or instant
description: As an experienced player, I want to change the game speed setting so that I can reduce waiting times for animations and AI decisions, allowing for a faster-paced game.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the player is in a game and the game speed is set to 'Normal', when the player navigates to the in-game settings menu and selects the 'Fast' game speed option, then all subsequent game animations (e.g., dice rolls, token movement) play at an accelerated rate, and AI decision delays are reduced.
technical_tasks: Given the game speed is set to 'Fast' or 'Instant' and the human player is involved in a property auction, when the auction begins, then the game speed is automatically and temporarily set to 'Normal' for the entire duration of the auction and reverts to the player's chosen setting afterward.
definition_of_done: Given a player has set the game speed to 'Fast', when the player saves the game, exits, and then loads that saved game, then the game speed setting is correctly restored to 'Fast' and the game continues at that pace.
column15: All acceptance criteria are met. The game speed setting correctly modifies animation and AI delay timings. The auction override works as specified. The setting is correctly persisted in save game files. The feature is integration tested and merged.

title: Adjust master
description: and sound effect volumes independently
story_points: As a player, I want to independently adjust the master, music, and sound effect volume levels so that I can customize the game's audio to my personal preference for a more enjoyable experience.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the player is in the settings menu and background music is playing, when the player moves the 'Music' volume slider, then the volume of the background music changes in real-time to match the slider's value.
technical_tasks: Given the player is in the settings menu, when the player moves the 'Sound Effects' volume slider, then a sample sound effect is played at the new volume level to provide immediate feedback.
definition_of_done: Given the player has set the Music volume to 30% and Sound Effects volume to 80%, when the player closes the game completely and then relaunches it, then the game's audio levels are at 30% and 80% respectively, and the sliders in the settings menu reflect these saved values.
column15: All acceptance criteria are met. The three volume sliders are functional and control the correct audio channels. Changes provide real-time feedback. All settings are correctly persisted between game sessions. The code is reviewed and merged.

title: Reset all my historical statistics and high scores
description: As a Data-Conscious Player, I want an option in the settings menu to permanently delete all my historical gameplay statistics and high scores after a confirmation prompt, so that I can have a clean slate and start tracking my performance from scratch.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given I have existing historical statistics, when I navigate to the settings menu, click the 'Reset All Player Data' button, and click 'Confirm' on the subsequent confirmation dialog, then all my historical player statistics are reset to their default zero state in the database.
technical_tasks: Given I have existing historical statistics, when I click the 'Reset All Player Data' button, then a modal confirmation dialog appears, pausing all other interactions and warning me that the action is permanent.
definition_of_done: Given I have existing historical statistics, when I click the 'Reset All Player Data' button and then click 'Cancel' on the confirmation dialog, then no data is modified or deleted.
column15: All acceptance criteria are met. The reset feature is functional and requires user confirmation. The data is correctly and permanently deleted from the database. The feature is integration tested and merged.

title: Provide a bulk deletion option for all saved games via the settings menu
description: As a user who wants to manage my game data, I want an option in the settings menu to delete all my saved games at once, with a confirmation step, so that I can easily clear out old progress and start fresh without having to manually find and delete files on my computer.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the user has at least one saved game file and is viewing the in-game settings menu, when the user clicks the 'Delete All Saved Games' button AND clicks 'Confirm' on the subsequent confirmation dialog, then all files within the '%APPDATA%/MonopolyTycoon/saves' directory are permanently deleted.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the user has opened the deletion confirmation dialog, when the user clicks the 'Cancel' button, then the confirmation dialog closes AND no files are deleted from the save directory.
technical_tasks: Given the user has no saved game files, when the user navigates to the settings menu, then the 'Delete All Saved Games' button is visibly disabled and cannot be clicked.
column14: All acceptance criteria are met. The feature correctly deletes all save files after user confirmation. The cancel flow works correctly. The button state is correctly managed based on the presence of save files. The feature is integration tested and merged.

title: Start an optional interactive tutorial to learn the game
description: As a new player, I want to start an optional, interactive tutorial so that I can learn the basic rules and game controls in a guided, hands-on environment before playing a full game.
definition_of_done: Given the user is on the main menu screen, when the user clicks the 'Tutorial' button, then the game transitions to a dedicated, scripted tutorial game state.
column14: Given the tutorial has started and it is the player's first turn, when the tutorial prompts the player to roll the dice by highlighting the 'Roll' button and displaying an instructional overlay, then the player's interaction is restricted to that button, and clicking it proceeds with a pre-determined roll result.
column15: Given the player has completed the final guided action in the tutorial script, when the final action is confirmed, then a 'Tutorial Complete' modal dialog is displayed with options to 'Start New Game' or 'Return to Main Menu'.
column17: All acceptance criteria are met. The tutorial can be launched and provides a guided, scripted experience covering core mechanics. User input is correctly restricted during the tutorial. The tutorial can be completed or exited cleanly. The feature is integration tested and merged.

title: Access and search a digital rulebook from game menus
description: As a player, I want to open a searchable digital rulebook from both the main menu and the in-game pause menu so that I can quickly find and clarify specific game rules without leaving the application.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given a player is in an active game, when the player opens the pause menu and clicks the 'Rulebook' button, then the rulebook UI is displayed as a modal overlay, the game in the background is paused, and the full list of rules is visible and scrollable.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the rulebook UI is open, when the player types a keyword (e.g., 'mortgage') into the search bar, then the list of rules is dynamically filtered to show only the sections and entries containing the keyword 'mortgage', and the keyword is visually highlighted.
technical_tasks: Given the game is launched, when the player opens the rulebook, then the content displayed is sourced from a structured JSON data file, not hardcoded in the application.
column14: All acceptance criteria are met. The rulebook is accessible from all required locations. The search functionality works correctly. The game state is correctly paused when accessed in-game. Rulebook content is loaded from an external file. The feature is reviewed and merged.

title: Save game progress into one of several save slots
description: As a player, I want to save my current game progress into a specific save slot at the start of my turn, so that I can safely exit the game and resume playing from the same point at a later time.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given I am in an active game and it is the start of my turn, before I have rolled the dice, when I open the pause menu, select 'Save Game', and click on an 'Empty' save slot, then the complete current GameState object is serialized into a versioned JSON file with a checksum in the correct save directory.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given I am in the 'Save Game' menu and I click on a slot that contains a previously saved game, when a confirmation dialog appears asking to overwrite the save and I select 'Yes', then the existing save file for that slot is replaced with the new game state data.
technical_tasks: Given it is an AI player's turn OR it is my turn but after I have rolled the dice, when I open the pause menu, then the 'Save Game' button is visually disabled and is not clickable.
column14: All acceptance criteria are met. The game can be saved into one of the available slots. Overwriting saves requires confirmation. The save option is correctly disabled outside of the allowed turn phase. The saved file contains all necessary game state data, a version, and a checksum. The feature is integration tested and merged.

title: Load a game from a previously saved slot
description: As a returning player, I want to select and load a previously saved game from the main menu, so that I can seamlessly continue my progress without having to start over.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given I am on the main menu and have at least one valid saved game file, when I navigate to the 'Load Game' screen, select the valid save slot, and confirm the load action, then the game transitions to the main gameplay scene and the entire game state is perfectly restored to the moment it was saved.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given I am on the 'Load Game' screen, when the list of save slots is displayed, then each occupied and valid slot must display the player's profile name, the date and time of the save, and the turn number.
technical_tasks: Given I am on the 'Load Game' screen and at least one save file has failed its checksum validation, when the list of save slots is displayed, then the slot corresponding to the corrupted file is visually marked as 'Corrupted' or 'Unusable' and is disabled.
column14: All acceptance criteria are met. A valid save game can be successfully loaded, restoring the game state perfectly. The load game screen displays correct metadata. The system gracefully handles corrupted and incompatible save files. The feature is integration tested and merged.

title: Visually indicate unusable save files on the load game screen
description: As a Returning Player, I want to see a clear, visual indication on the load game screen for any save files that are corrupted or incompatible with the current game version, so that I can immediately understand which games I can no longer play and avoid the frustration of attempting to load a broken save file.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given a save file exists whose content does not match its stored checksum, when the player navigates to the 'Load Game' screen, then the entry for that save slot is visually distinct (e.g., greyed out), clearly labeled as 'Corrupted', and the 'Load' button is disabled for that slot.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given a valid save file exists that was created with an older, incompatible version of the game, when the player navigates to the 'Load Game' screen, then the entry for that save slot is visually distinct, clearly labeled as 'Incompatible Version', and the 'Load' button is disabled.
technical_tasks: Given a save slot is marked as 'Corrupted' or 'Incompatible Version', when the player hovers the mouse cursor over the entry, then a tooltip appears with an informative message, such as 'This save file is corrupted and cannot be loaded.'
column14: All acceptance criteria are met. The load screen correctly identifies and displays states for corrupted and incompatible save files. Interaction with invalid save slots is disabled. Informative tooltips are provided. The logic is unit tested and merged.

title: View a list of my top 10 victories
description: As a competitive player who tracks my performance, I want to access a Top 10 High Score screen from the main menu, so that I can review my most successful victories, see how I'm improving, and be motivated to beat my own records.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the player has won 10 or more games, when the player selects the 'Top Scores' option from the main menu, then a screen is displayed showing a list of exactly 10 entries, sorted in descending order of Final Net Worth.
technical_tasks: Given the player has won 4 games, when the player navigates to the 'Top Scores' screen, then the list displays exactly 4 entries, sorted correctly.
definition_of_done: Given the player's top 10 list is full, with the 10th best score having a net worth of $5000, when the player wins a new game with a final net worth of $6000, then the new victory record is added to the top scores list, the old 10th place score is removed, and the list remains sorted and contains exactly 10 entries.
column15: All acceptance criteria are met. The Top Scores screen correctly displays a sorted list of up to 10 victories. The system handles empty and partially full lists correctly. The logic for adding a new score and evicting the lowest score is functional. The feature is integration tested and merged.

title: Export my top score history to a text file
description: As a competitive player who tracks my performance, I want to export my Top 10 High Scores list to a simple, human-readable text file, so that I can easily share my achievements with friends or keep a personal record of my best games outside of the application.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given the player is on the 'Top Score History' screen with scores listed, when the player clicks the 'Export to Text' button, selects a valid location in the native Windows 'Save As' dialog, and confirms the save, then a '.txt' file is created at the specified location.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given a high score file has been successfully exported, when the user opens the exported '.txt' file, then the file contains a clear header, each score entry is on a new line, and all data fields (Rank, Name, Net Worth, Duration, Turns) are present and match the in-game UI.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the player is viewing the 'Top Score History' screen, when the high score list is empty, then the 'Export to Text' button is visibly disabled and not clickable.
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria are met. The export function is available and works correctly. The exported file has the correct format and content. The UI button is correctly disabled when no scores are present. The feature is reviewed and merged.

title: Change the game's visual and audio theme
description: As a player, I want to select and apply different visual and audio themes for the game, so that I can customize my experience and keep the game feeling fresh and engaging over multiple playthroughs.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given the player is on the main menu and the 'Classic' theme is active, when the player navigates to the Settings menu, selects the 'Futuristic' theme, and confirms the selection, then the main menu's UI skin, background visuals, and background music immediately change to the 'Futuristic' theme assets.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the player is in an active game with the 'Classic' theme, when the player opens the pause menu, selects the 'Futuristic' theme, confirms, and then resumes the game, then all in-game assets, including the game board, player tokens, and UI/HUD, are updated to the 'Futuristic' theme.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the player has previously selected and applied the 'Futuristic' theme and has closed the application, when the player launches the game again, then the game starts up with the 'Futuristic' theme already active.
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria are met. The theme system allows for dynamic swapping of visual and audio assets. The change can be made from the main menu or in-game. The selected theme is correctly persisted between sessions. The system includes at least two distinct themes. The feature is integration tested and merged.

title: Be notified of available game updates on startup
description: As a Game Player, I want to be notified in a non-intrusive way when a new version of the game is available upon startup, so that I can easily access the latest features, bug fixes, and improvements without having to manually check for updates.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given I have an older version of the game installed and an active internet connection, and a newer version is available, when I launch the application, then the game performs a version check asynchronously, and a non-intrusive notification is displayed on the main menu with a clickable link to the download page.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given I have the latest version of the game installed, when I launch the application, then the game performs the version check, and no update notification is displayed.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given I do not have an active internet connection, when I launch the application, then the version check fails silently in the background, no error message is displayed to me, and the game loads to the main menu normally.
technical_tasks: N/A
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria are met. The update check is non-blocking and handles success, no-update, and failure scenarios gracefully. The notification provides a direct link for manual download. The feature is reviewed and merged.

title: View the game's data privacy statement
description: As a privacy-conscious user, I want to access and read a clear data privacy statement from the main menu, so that I can understand what data the game collects, how it is stored, and confirm that it operates entirely offline, which builds my trust in the application.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given the user is on the main menu screen, when the user clicks the 'Privacy Policy' button, then a modal view appears, displaying the game's data privacy statement.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the privacy statement view is open, when the user reads the content, then the text must accurately confirm that the application operates entirely offline, all user-generated data is stored locally, and no data is transmitted to any external server.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the privacy statement view is open, when the user clicks the 'Close' or 'Back' button, then the view is dismissed, and the main menu becomes interactive again.
technical_tasks: N/A
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria are met. The privacy statement is accessible from the main menu. The content is accurate and loaded from a resource file. The UI is functional and user-friendly. The feature is reviewed and merged.
